channel.title: Comments on: Rabbi Isaac Breuer on Rabbi SR Hirsch
channel.description: notes on Jewish theology and spirituality

item.title: By: Lawrence Kaplan
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Kaplan
item.description: It's been a while since I read the essay, but my impression always was that it was directed mainly against Scholem's recent very harsh and rather nasty review of Breuer's Neue Kusari. I believe that there is one pretty clear allusion in the essay to the review. That is, "Say whatever you want about my book, but don't rmess with my great and sainted grandfther!"
item.content:encoded: It’s been a while since I read the essay, but my impression always was that it was directed mainly against Scholem’s recent very harsh and rather nasty review of Breuer’s Neue Kusari. I believe that there is one pretty clear allusion in the essay to the review. That is, “Say whatever you want about my book, but don’t rmess with my great and sainted grandfther!”
